dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Asshole, move your fucking truck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to join me?   There's plenty of food.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll wait. Meet me by the cement mixer when you're ready.

dialogue.raw_text: The last time I saw you, you had just come from a funeral. How are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. Death is like so weird. I mean, it's sad, but I also feel like I've been given this sign. A sign which is telling me, life is short, so you gotta do what makes you happy. You gotta take chances. You gotta get crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing to "get crazy"?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I play the flute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) Yeah, that's totally nuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not that. See, every year my school has this recital. I've always been too scared to play a solo in front of people, but this year I've decided to do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good for you. When is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you care?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause I'm gonna go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? You can't go!    Nobody goes to these things. I don't even think my mom is going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You gotta have somebody rooting for ya. Besides, I like music, and I owe you for bringing me lunch. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Front row. Malee smiles.    She's got a major crush on Gus now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs, embarrassed) Okay. Tuesday at 8:30 in the junior high school auditorium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (vulnerable) Don't say it if you don't mean it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be there.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: years to life at least.

dialogue.raw_text: So I'm just supposed to sit here and take it? Be like you guys.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Life goes on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It does. You have to deal with it. If you don't, it could like eat you alive forever. 90 percent of people's problems is due to their inability to get over the past.

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Off Jacob, thinking-

dialogue.raw_text: That's awesome. Can I listen in sometime?

dialogue.raw_text: No. Anyway, she says, if a person wants closure, they gotta deal with their problems head on. Go see these guys and let them know how you feel.

dialogue.raw_text: Go alone. Juvy hall is only like forty minutes from here. Take the bus.

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Jeff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's sick.     I think he...

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) I hate you. You know that?     You bastard.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, you deformed retard! The only reason we started picking on you guys in the first place was because of that thing on your face.

dialogue.raw_text: Every night, I lie in bed and plan your murder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm shaking.

dialogue.raw_text: First I'm going to take a kitchen knife and chop off your fingers then your nose then your tongue. Then I'm gonna poke out your eyes with the end of a broomstick. Well, not really poke them out, but I'm gonna push them back into your brain. Then I'm gonna take scissors and cut off your ears. When they find you, it's gonna be like putting a jigsaw puzzle back together. (CONTINUED)

dialogue.raw_text: What happened was an accident.

dialogue.raw_text: Leonard, put everything back.

dialogue.raw_text: Just put everything back and go to sleep.

direction.raw_text: NEXT DAY - AFTERNOON Malee is riding her bike on the sidewalk when she sees Gus, exit his car and enter her mother's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How was your week?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Same. Still can't sleep. When I do, nightmares.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yacco and Gus sit across from each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Post traumatic stress is very common in your line of work. Many fire fighters go through this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. But why now? I haven't fought fires in ten years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sometimes we experience something so horrific, our memory blocks it out. That way we won't have to relive the pain. It's called repression. Our bodies are not so forgiving, however. Inside, we feel the effects of trauma even when we don't know why.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does that mean? (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gus looks to her, confused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Something stirred your unconscious. If we find out what that was, we can begin the healing process.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You told me last week, the nightmares started about the time you moved here. Let's look at that. Why did you move here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A friend was making good money with construction. He got an offer to build that extension off Lindsay Acres. He suggested I come into town and work for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You know, for the past few weeks, I sat in this house. I couldn't move. Everything reminded me of Rudy. Then from out of nowhere I had a revelation. I am alive! Your mother is alive! I became overcome with joy because I realized how lucky we are to still have you.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (half crazed) I went to work today. For the first time in weeks. It was as if I had just gotten out of college! I was fearless! I went after accounts I had avoided for years because I thought they were out of my league. I spoke to presidents, vice presidents, business managers, sales reps. I was amazing. I was magic. But when I came home to share the news with your mother, I discovered her asleep. When I looked around the house, I realized that her "office", for lack of a better word, was also piled up. So, I took to the house. I have made it my duty to clean this place from top to bottom. Even if it takes me all night, I don't care. Jacob?

direction.raw_text: Obviously drunk, Gus stumbles to his front door.   He fumbles for his keys and enters.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the other. Distraught and at the point of tears, Gus opens the chamber and loads the gun with a single bullet. Then he spins the chamber and locks it. Gus puts the gun to his head and fires. NOTHING. He throws the gun across the room, grabs the bottle of whiskey and drinks it till it's gone.

dialogue.raw_text: Jeff Laskey is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He used his bed sheet, waited until lights out and then jumped.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's terrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His cell mate let him hang there the entire night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Kenny.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew he wouldn't make it. It's my fault too. Jeff wasn't a saint when I met him, but he sure as hell wasn't headed here. (tearing up) That fucking asshole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

Ashley, dressed in her finest Christmas sweater, peruses the fireplace mantel and all of the decorations that line it. She is a drastically different woman than the last time we saw her. direction.raw_text: a hair away from firing -

dialogue.raw_text: About my age.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I think when two people connect, they connect for other reasons. And since soulmates are eternal, they have no age.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, hauntingly) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see you tonight.    Don't be late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Grace lies in a hosptial bed, watching TV. Leonard enters, dressed in a hospital gown. Grace turns to him, smiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leonard! (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leonard leans over and kisses his mother's forehead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, mom. I didn't mean to leave the gas on. It was an accident. And everything that happened, I... I just thought that maybe, I could help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leonard, my mother died at 52. We had to cremate her body because they didn't make a coffin big enough for her to fit in. Even if they had, no one could have carried it. (tearing up) I loved her so much. I don't want that to happen to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't have to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even if I can manage the food... Can you honestly see me, running a marathon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to run a marathon. You just have to run to the end of the block. It's not so hard as you think it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll try.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I spoke to your father. He and the girls caught a flight. They should be here by morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you tell him what happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told him there was a gas leak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I meant... (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leonard smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know what you meant. I didn't tell him. I don't think I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JACOB'S HOME - BEDROOM - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT Jacob lies awake, staring out the window.     A heavy wind blows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : WATCH ALARM Jacob sits up and silences his watch alarm. Keith awakens as well, but remains silent. He watches as Jacob grabs a bag and exits the house through the window. Once he's gone, Keith gets off the top bunk, crosses to the window and watches as Jacob runs off. Immediately, Keith crosses to the closet. He removes the lock box and begins trying combinations to open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A heavy rain begins to fall as Jacob rides up. He sees Kenny, standing inside of a partially, constructed house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny throws Jacob a PONCHO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob removes his backpack and puts on the poncho. Then he opens his backpack and removes his HOCKEY MASK. (The same mask he was wearing at the beginning of the movie.)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put this on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What the fuck is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If people see me riding around in the middle of the night, we're screwed. You didn't bring a disguise? (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The boys start riding off in opposite directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny files in behind Jacob, and the boys make their way deep into the construction site. Thunder and lightning crash.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who gives a shit what I'm up to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The main road is this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but if we cut through the construction site, we'll hit the railroad tracks. It's faster and no one will bother us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JACOB'S HOME - BEDROOM - SAME TIME Keith has forgone opening the lock box via a combination and now tries to pry the top open with a SCREWDRIVER. He works frantically, fearing Jacob's return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob and Henry make their way to the edge of the construction site. Suddenly, Jacob stops in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob lifts the hockey mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob begins rummaging through his backpack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JACOB'S HOME - BEDROOM - SAME TIME Keith pries the box open.       It's EMPTY.   No gun or bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch! I knew it.     I knew you'd chicken... Jacob rises, holding the gun.   He points it at Kenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob shakes, frightened and reluctant to do what he believes he has to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob cocks the gun.   Tears stream down his checks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob fires. Kenny is hit in the head.      He drops to the ground instantly. The force of the gun, knocks Jacob to the ground.      As he falls, the hockey mask comes down over his face. Jacob sits for a beat, staring at Kenny's lifeless body. Lightning flashes, illuminating his blue eyes through the hockey mask.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What the fuck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't let you leave, Kenny.     You have to pay for what you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa, whoa hold on. Alright, I... I won't go. I'll stay here. I'll do my probation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You killed him. I gotta do this... for my family. It's the only way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jacob, I told ya, it... it was an accident. I swear. Please, don't. This isn't you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. But I can't be a pussy all my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jacob is inside one of the UNPAVED house foundations, digging a hole. He cries, struggling to finish what he has done. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Once a hole is dug, Jacob throws Kenny's body inside and starts covering it up with dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JACOB'S HOME - BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Jacob climbs through his window, soaking wet. He crosses to his closet and begins to change. Keith lies in bed, watching. Jacob removes the gun from his pocket and places it back inside the lock box. His hands shake violently. As he puts the box back inside the closet. He finds Rudy's glove. He smells the leather and smiles. Jacob takes the glove and crosses over to his bed.    He places the glove beside Keith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob lies down on his bed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought I wasn't supposed to touch this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're awake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's yours. Just don't leave it outside. If it gets wet, the leather will crack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take good care of it.   I know this was Rudy's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Why do you have a gun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a b-b gun. I returned it to a friend of mine. (beat) I'm sorry for being such an asshole to ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does this mean we're brothers now? (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Keith lies back in bed, smiling. Jacob rolls over, still unnerved by what he is done. He'll never be the same, and he knows it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, torn apart) Yeah. We're brothers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gus loads cinder blocks into a wheel barrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gus spins around, and finds Malee, standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malee opens her backpack and removes Gus' GUN.    Gus snatches it from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malee walks off.      Gus holds the gun in awe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Gus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Before you freak out, I want to tell you, I'm sorry. And to give you this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Malee?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be mad. I was just worried about you. Now I'm out of your life forever. Goodbye. Thanks for not pressing any charges.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: staring at the construction site.    We ZOOM OUT and find him, straddling his bike. Malee appears, walking over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand for a moment, watching the builders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob nods, YES. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Quite a storm last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Did you hear about Leonard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jacob doesn't answer. He is preoccupied with watching a
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Only him. I was gonna go and visit him at the hospital. You want to come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pour cement into the foundation where Kenny is buried. It's a bittersweet moment. While relieved by the fact that his crime will be hidden, the guilt overwhelms him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacob turns his bike around, and the two ride off together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malee eyes Jacob, sensing that something is wrong.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Earth to Jacob. You coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?   Oh, yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, your birthday's coming up. Any hints as to what you might like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever you get me will be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed) Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Are you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lying) Never better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the foundation. Gus enters frame and begins spreading cement over Kenny's grave.
